website_summaries.verdict: With added water resistance and a better camera, the LTE-enabled Moto G is one of the best affordable unlocked smartphones around right now.
pros: The new Moto G has improved design, water resistance and a stepped-up camera
The design and hand feel are great, and the battery lasts more than a full day
cons: Processor speed lags if you're trying to do many things at once
The entry-level version (8GB of storage, 1GB of RAM) is too underpowered compared to the slightly pricier step-up model

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic phone
customer_reviews.text: I've had my moto g for about 5 months now, and I absolutely love it. It is able to update to Android 6.0 and runs pretty smoothly. It's also pretty tough. I work outdoors and its survived getting submerged in water, falling about 12 feet onto rock, and some other less exciting mishaps. So far there isn't even a scratch or scuff to show for my clumsiness. The only recommendation I really have is to splurge for a bit more storage than the 8gb. With the new Android you can format an SD card to act as internal storage, but your performance will still be better if the apps are stored in the phone.
customer_reviews.author: McKee

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Size of the phone is perfect in my hand and pocket 720p resolution is good enough Works with T-Mobile CONS: Slow after a couple of months of use Stock charger is trash OTHER: I had this product since April 2016. I would have given this a highly rated review, but ever since February 2017, the smartphone became too slow for me. It even has trouble loading the most basic apps like email. Apps are always disappearing every time I turn on the phone. But the apps come back after, say, 10 minutes; but that is still annoying because I have to put back the app shortcuts every time. My next smartphone will definitely NOT be a Motorola brand.
customer_reviews.author: CoronaLite

customer_reviews.title: This phone does not work well if you want to ...
customer_reviews.text: This phone does not work well if you want to use it for anything beyond making and receiving phone calls. The preloaded apps take up so much storage that the phone malfunctions when using it for texting, taking pictures, etc. There is no storage left over for these things. I sought help from the manufacturer and they had discontinued the phone for the exact reason I have listed above. I would rate this phone lower than 1 star. Save yourself the headache.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Guzik

customer_reviews.title: All around outstanding phone!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mother for her birtday and I'm jealous I should have gotten for myself. For a first time smartphone users you can't find a better phone or value. This is a great phone with good enough display and snappy performance for non-power users. Camera is good all around and takes good video for what she uses it for. Speakers are loud and sound good even near max. Note: mother does not have a lot of apps does not do multitask or play many games so experience may differ if you are into lots of apps and play games. If I had to buy another I definitely would go with the 16GB instead of the 8GB.
customer_reviews.author: FTC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Phone is good value for the money. Mine came unlocked as expected and I use it with a phone card and wifi. The phone is a little larger than I would like, but this makes looking at the screen and typing easier if you are willing to deal with the extra pocket room. My daughter has also owned one of these phones for over a year with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Funky Astronomer

customer_reviews.title: I had a first generation Moto G that was great, but I am less than thrilled with this ...
customer_reviews.text: Usable storage is a joke. 83 pictures and one app and I do not have enough space to receive text messages. The phone does some crazy things too. When the phone is on the home screen it randomly plays the voice mail on speaker. I had a first generation Moto G that was great, but I am less than thrilled with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Mostly great.
customer_reviews.text: It works well and I'd have rated higher but I'm coming from a blackberry bold and the larger size makes it difficult to keep in front pants pocket, so I find it very inconvenient to answer calls etc. Also, the size makes one-handed operation awkward. But aside from these peeves browsing is far better and the camera is surprisingly good. I haven't had an occasion to verify its water resistance, but I'm glad to know that being caught in the rain should be OK. If the size doesn't bother you then you'll probably like this phone a lot and for around one fifty it was a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: bb user

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent
customer_reviews.text: Headphone quality and external speakers are very good. Solid built phone doesn't look or feel cheap. Stock Android is clean and fast. I have no problems with this phone. Look forward to Motorola in the future. Spending $400 or more on a phone is unnecessary really.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy L.

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat the value
customer_reviews.text: I wish they had not followed the general trend of larger-is-better between G1 and this gen3, but other improvements make it a significant upgrade. The waterproof feature is good with a very minor negative impact on audio quality (I assume from sealing membrane). The gestures to directly bring up the camera or flashlight are great and not just a gimmick. It is no fruit phone but it does everything I need. The camera is usable (unlike gen1 potatocam) and the screen is clear and contrasty.
customer_reviews.author: jenifer taylor

customer_reviews.title: We love 'em
customer_reviews.text: Bought one for me and my wife. They are great handsets- we can do anything and everything we could want out of a smartphone for under $200. I researched and studied so many options and when this came out it had everything we were looking for. My wife wanted a good camera and it has one for sure! I have been very surprised with the quality of some of the pictures she has taken. I would highly recommend it. Also - we got the 1gb ram version and have not noticed any issues with usage - even with a lot of apps open (which I don't tend to do often).
customer_reviews.author: Tetrarch

customer_reviews.title: One of the best values out there, but under powered for the media junkie.
customer_reviews.text: These are good basic smart phones and are fully Google integrated. It works fine for me as I mostly use one app at a time and don't spend a lot of time playing on my phone. (I work behind a PC much of my day, so any 'browsing' I do is on a big screen). In you are a 'power user' and want six apps running at once, then you will not be happy with this device. It is also short on memory if you are a media junkie. Given the performance of the device and its price point, I consider this one of the best values out there.
customer_reviews.author: Adam J. McKee

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY IF YOU HAVE T-MOBILE
customer_reviews.text: Phone does not work with T-Mobile. All the Apps work; texting works; plays music, etc. Unfortunately there is a bug with the software and incoming phone calls have no audio, in or out. Now have to decide if I'm going to have Motorola repair the item, or just return it. What I really can't believe is that Motorola would ship an item with a known problem. I tried all the suggestions of wiping the cache etc. with no luck. A phone that can't make phone calls? Why would they ship this? Unbelievable.
customer_reviews.author: Gideon J. King

customer_reviews.title: Great photo quality photos!  Rivals a samsung
customer_reviews.text: Works just as well and does the same jobs as other very expensive smart phones. The camera is amazing for a phone under $200. Photo quality is up there with a samsung.And you don't lose quality when you crop a photo to get a close up. After doing a bunch of research, I bought 4 of these. One for each member of the family. No regrets at all. The only thing lacking is, it could use more memory. But that's easily solved by by adding an inexpensive mini SD card, which totally solves that problem. The great price was also very appreciated as I am on a very fixed income. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Alley cat

customer_reviews.title: Phone doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this phone and it doesn't work right out of the box. Is unable to connect to mobile data. Contacted Motorola, they are charging me $40 to replace something that is a manufacturer defect. I paid this much for a phone and now I have to pay an extra $40 because Motorola didn't get it right.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: I chose the 2/16 gb version figuring the extra ram would help things run smoothly and it hasn't disappointed. Used the old nano
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Android phone and I must say it has exceeded my expectations. I wanted something with a stock Android feel without the flagship phone price. I chose the 2/16 gb version figuring the extra ram would help things run smoothly and it hasn't disappointed. Used the old nano sim from my previous phone, a iPhone 5s, in an nano to micro adapter and was getting 4G LTE on at&t with no calls or trip to the store. Installed a 64gb SD card, even though Motorola says 32gb max, and its working fine. Time will tell how well it holds up. I think it's the best thing out there for the price.
customer_reviews.author: DavidH

customer_reviews.title: Initially I really liked the phone and it's pretty reasonably priced
customer_reviews.text: Initially I really liked the phone and it's pretty reasonably priced, but unfortunately it hasn't held up over time. Within months of the warranty expiring my phone started to have issues - it kind of seemed like an old car that was near the end of its life, even though I've barely it had for a year. The GPS and screen rotation don't always work anymore, a couple times it's gotten stuck for up to an hour performing updates / maintenance after being turned off, and now it looks like it's developed problems charging, which means the phone is probably done. Just over a year of use and I'm already on here shopping for a new one. Thanks Motorola.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: why no gyroscope????
customer_reviews.text: great product for the price. being low end, you'd expect limited features compared to higher end like moto x, but dang it... why is there NO GYROSCOPE!? that alone takes off 2 stars for me because i believe gyroscope should be BASIC for any smartphone. I mean cheaper Blu phones have gyroscopes for crying out loud.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Micro SD reader stops working, making the phone quite useless (too little storage)
customer_reviews.text: The phone is good, although the Micro SD reader stopped working, so lost pictures and now I have very limited space on my phone (total is 8GB but system takes 4), cannot install new apps. Seems that it happened to many people, but still unaddressed (for ref just search for keyword "Moto G 3rd gen stopped recognizing SD card ")
customer_reviews.author: Mat

customer_reviews.title: For the quality it is awesome. I seriously thinkthink this was something worth more ...
customer_reviews.text: Let's acknowledge that for a phone at this priceprice, I can't complain. For the quality it is awesome. I seriously thinkthink this was something worth more than 200 but no complaints on the price either. Everything about this phone makes me think that I don't need the best for when I'm out as I get what I need no problems. If your on a budget and want a good phone for a cheap price, then go with this phone. You can't go wrong. Battery is good. If you watch a lot of videos then you might be needing an outlet but otherwise good.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Florido

customer_reviews.title: Good phone for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: This phone doesn't have the greatest display in the world but I can live with the lower resolution display. The batter life on this phone is outstanding and that's the main reason for my purchase. I switched from a Nexus 5 in which the battery life was atrocious. This phone is durable, splash proof (I won't be testing it's waterproof capabilities,) and does everything I need it to.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: due to their good ratings in several magazines
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone in July 2016. It has worked well since then, and it has been well taken care of, but the volume just ceased on it two days ago. I would think for $180, I’d get a phone whose speakers would have lasted longer than 17 months. This is the second Motorola phone I’ve purchased, due to their good ratings in several magazines, and the other phone lasted only 12 months. I think it’s time to switch brands, unfortunately I’m not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: I've been in love with the Moto G for a couple of years ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been in love with the Moto G for a couple of years now, because you can experience a pure Android experience with out those annoying extra apps that you can delete, so I decide to upgrade from a 1st. gen to a 3rd. gen, I bought it because it said it was globally unlock, unfortunately the version that I received the 3G network didn't work properly in my country so I had to return it
customer_reviews.author: Marly

customer_reviews.title: Not sure why my review was edited / deleted but ...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why my review was edited / deleted but this phone came defective. The sim card slot did not hold the sim card properly and would not work and the SD card slot did not work either. Also, I was not informed prior to ordering that the phone. Return was successful.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: cool phone. easily open camera or flashlight while the ...
customer_reviews.text: cool phone. easily open camera or flashlight while the phone is locked. This phone is compatible with MetroPCS, but you'll need to contact them and pay about $15 to connect to the network. I couldn't be happier with my purchase. Its a great quality phone at a really reasonable price. It can also be used as a mobile hotspot. Has WIFI & bluetooth. The only downside I see so far is the screen is not as clear as my last android phone. It's not terrible, but noticeable. Overall, this phone is a fantastic phone as a great price. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: P. Palm

customer_reviews.title: and I'm glad I did
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my four-year-old Samsung Infuse 4G with this phone, and I'm glad I did. For $150, this is a great phone with really nice features--especially the twist-to-open-camera action. However, keep in mind that this IS a low-tier phone. If you want a phone that will take instagram-worthy shots, this is not the phone for you. The camera on this thing is average at best. Also, I've been noticing a lot of lag and general glitchiness lately. Also, you're going to need to invest in a microSD card for extra storage space, because this phone only comes with 4GB usable memory.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love my MOTO
customer_reviews.text: Nice to have a little larger MOTO, but this is as large as I will want. I've had some difficulty with the camera taking good pictures but I believe it is primarily operator headspace and timing. I love the display, the functioning, how fast it delivers web pages in the right environment, and many other great things about how it functions. I'll stick with Motorola from now on.
customer_reviews.author: JSF

customer_reviews.title: Excellent phone at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Moto G as my personal phone about six months ago - it has all the features I need. A great camera that takes HDR and 16:9 aspect pictures - been using the Moto G camera more than my 10 year old DSLR. Android has all the apps I need - I use iSyncr to sync with iTunes (you have to create custom playlists to sync podcasts), Google Photos for picture enhancing, Just Cleaner for optimizing and WebRoot for anti-virus protection. I have an iPhone 6+ for work and the Moto G works as well at less than half the price. No cons.
customer_reviews.author: mbsf

customer_reviews.title: and the Gs 1st & 2nd editions and this just keeps the good stuff coming
customer_reviews.text: We've had Moto E's, and the Gs 1st & 2nd editions and this just keeps the good stuff coming. The screen doesn't seem as brilliant as the 2nd Gen but the battery life is outstanding so I suspect they throttled the screen back a bit... who knows... it's still a great screen. It's also ridiculously lighter weight in the hand than the 2nd and noticeably smoother/faster at app switching, picture editing etc.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Really A Great Phone
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 Moto G (3rd Gen) phones - one for my wife and one for my college age daughter. They both love them. The phones seem well made with wonderful features. i don't know why any one would spend 4 - 5 times more for a smart phone. It takes great photos. It has great sound from the speakers. Oh, and it is a superb phone. Very pleased. Motorola was one of the early manufacturers to upgrade to Marshmallow. (I am still waiting for my other brand phone.)
customer_reviews.author: Kenton

customer_reviews.title: My first smartphone--very happy
customer_reviews.text: My first smartphone (I know, way behind the curve) which I'm using with the Walmart $30/month T-Mobile plan (I'd had my dumbphone with T-Mobile and was able to transfer my old number over to the new SIM card). I couldn't be more pleased. For someone like me who uses it for text, e-mail and some web surfing, and the occasional phone call, it's perfect and even keeps a charge for more than 4 days. Very happy so far!
customer_reviews.author: grenfend

customer_reviews.title: Completely unsatisfied
customer_reviews.text: After two months I bought this cell phone, I find myself completely unsatisfied with the product, it is impossible for a 2gb ram phone to not even play simple games that I used to play on a phone with 512mb of ram, the charging port works only if I move the connector after connecting it, the phone is constantly stucked using basic applications like fb, ig; The headset port is also damaged. I DO NOT recommend this phone, pay a little more and buy another one if you don't want to lose your money.
customer_reviews.author: Ignacio De Leon

customer_reviews.title: Great First Android Phone Experience
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Android device having used a Windows phone for two years. I am very pleased with the phone"s look and the way it operates. I choose this phone after doing a lot of research of current Android phones available, and chose this because it is almost pure Android without all the garbage that is loaded on to other phones. I have been using it on T- Mobile and have had no problems at all. The phone looks much more expensive than the actual price and others I have showed it to are also very impressed with the phone's looks and performance.
customer_reviews.author: MadChef

customer_reviews.title: It seems like the sim card reader was defective
customer_reviews.text: My phone only worked for one month. Then it died. I lost my money. the phone does not recognize any sim card from any operator. It seems like the sim card reader was defective. I went through all the guidelines of checking hardware. Then I reinitiated and restablished to factory settings with no success. Took it to a repair store and they told me the sim card reader was not working properly so thats why it wont recognize any sim card. No matter how many times i reset it. I lost my money. This is the third time I write to you and have not received any answer.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos T.

customer_reviews.title: Great phone, very nice camera, terrific value
customer_reviews.text: This replaces my Moto E. I was perfectly happy with that one, but foolishly bought the model with the least memory. An Android update wiped out the rest. Live and learn, buy the 16 GB model. The camera is infinitely better, all my apps run blazingly fast, and I cannot imagine a better phone for the money. Why get a "free" phone with a data plan, when your phone company will wind up charging you many hundreds of dollars? This is a much smarter solution.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Fitzpatrick

customer_reviews.title: OK, if it lasts
customer_reviews.text: 3.5 stars while it lasted. The SD card reader quit working after about 9 months. Bought a new SD card, same issue. This made the phone unusable. I deleted all the unnecessary apps but still could not install anything new or take pictures. It also seemed a bit buggy even when it worked, occasionally the screen would freeze when I received calls, not letting me answer.
customer_reviews.author: Eric P.

customer_reviews.title: The phone in good conditions. But every day he says without a ...
customer_reviews.text: The phone in good conditions. But every day he says without a sim and I put another sim and says the same I would like a part of the refund to have to accommodate the software I was a technician and he said that I was the reader yes, I think it's a fraud I want a refund, please, the piece comes to me at $ 20
customer_reviews.author: OSWALMIR MENDEZ

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Phone/Mini computer
customer_reviews.text: Great - it is unlocked and supposedly global - haven't had a chance to test that yet. Otherwise, it suits my needs well. This is my second Moto G, first was a first generation - I appreciate the better camera on the 3rd generation. It's fast to start up from a power off, and seems to have excellent battery life. This unit has the ability to expand memory via a micro card. I doubt that I'll ever put much on the system, but it's nice to know I could.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best under $200 phone out there.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, a great phone, it only has 1 gb of ram, but because it has very little manufacture special snowflake software, I had the first gen of the Moto G, great phone, then I decided to give the Asus ZenFone 5 a try, 1 gb of ram, and a faster processor than this version of the G, but because it was loaded with a ton ASUS's special snowflake blotware, it was massively sluggish, and the ZenFone warped after a month of use. Compared to this phone, which has a very solid feel. For under $200, this phone greatly exceeds my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Arik

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect phone. Period!
customer_reviews.text: I used to say that the Moto G is the best budget phone. But now I say it loud and clear: The Moto G 3rd Generation is the best phone out there. Why? - Battery life is one of the best I have ever Seen - Software is just right, no junk boltware. - Blazing fast performance. - Camera is almost perfect. - Gestures are pretty cool and handy - And yeah, water resistant! Why pay 600+ USD on Samsung Junk or Apple's limited software. I highly recommend this phone!
customer_reviews.author: Sweiss

customer_reviews.title: won't last
customer_reviews.text: The size and features were nice, but don't plan on using this phone for very long. Despite 16GB of storage and constant clean-up mine got unacceptably slow within maybe a year or so, making the GPS function prettymuch worthless since it couldn't lock into the more than adequate cell signal and give me the direction til after I'd passed the turn. Spend the $200 on a better phone that will last you longer.
customer_reviews.author: Keturah Kiehl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent phone missing a key componnent
customer_reviews.text: It's a good phone. Why not 5 stars? I knew what I was buying. I knew it didn't have an NFC chip and that it was only 16Gb. I got it because of its size. Almost every other phone out there was bigger and my wife wanted a smaller phone that she could put in her pockets. I don't think a phone today shouldn't have an NFC chip. Everything else is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy for sure
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything about it. The Motions sensors are the best, the way you switch on the camera and torchlight. Used it for a long time and it's still good. Dropped it many times and no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Shaw

customer_reviews.title: My first smart phone so I have nothing to compare to
customer_reviews.text: My first smart phone so I have nothing to compare to, but so far this phone is great! Did quite a bit of research before purchasing and I think this is probably the best phone under $200. Update 3/28/16 After forced "marshmallow" update, phone has been awful. Apps take forever to load and crash constantly. Battery life became so bad I had to delete almost all of my apps so I could get one day of minimal use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: ebeck

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone !
customer_reviews.text: Amazing Phone for $180 or less ! This phone is NOT for power users. I would recommend this phone for people who will mostly use for: *Web browsing *Phone / Texting *Playing Non High Graphic Games - Solitaire / Tetris *GPS / Directions *Music Player *Youtube This Phone will be updated to Android 6 AKA Marshmallow in the next couple months !
customer_reviews.author: Struzzin

customer_reviews.title: It becomes very laggy and buggy
customer_reviews.text: The phone is very nice and slim. However once you start just adding some minor apps and start software upgrades your phone will run significantly slower and even come to a crawl. It becomes very laggy and buggy and will take forever to go from one task to another. Even with all windows closed and running bare bone activities it becomes very hard to remain somewhat happy with phone. If you are thinking of getting this phone wait until you have enough for the 16GB version. Iam sure with a bigger memory you will be able to run most of your appas with no issues. Other than that the Battery life was amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Art Flores

customer_reviews.title: Simple and pleasant upgrade from previous generation.
customer_reviews.text: Pros- faster, zippier than previous generation. 2gb Ram for faster processing. Cons- removed Moto Assist which had a cool driving mode. Also Motorola migrate is gone too...had to use third party apps for both needs. Other notes: this version does not have NFC, no notification light - not deal breakers for me. Phone is as expected.... pleasant and simple upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: tech

customer_reviews.title: It's our first smartphone, so I don't have a ...
customer_reviews.text: It's our first smartphone, so I don't have a lot to compare it with. All the research I did definitely points to this phone, esp since we're not looking for the most recent, cutting edge phone. We bought the universally unlocked phone so that we could use AT&T or T-Mobile. One problem of note is that while it has 4G LTE, the service provider I chose, Ting, couldn't make use of it in our area. The towers in this area apparently handle up to 3G LTE but not 4G. So that's something to consider.
customer_reviews.author: John Croes

customer_reviews.title: Great phone, great price
customer_reviews.text: Great phone, great price. I bought this one after researching a replacement for my vendor-provided phone. This one is a great balance between performance and features on one side, and price on the other. I can't speak to the out-of-the-box experience, as I immediately installed Cyanogenmod on it. Still, I can say this is a good buy if you're looking for a feature-rich phone for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan L. Fordham

customer_reviews.title: great phone!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for an older friend as their first smartphone. awesome smartphone at this price point clear crisp screen call clarity is excellent and music listening is good and loud can connect to otg cables lte compatible good camera at close range Hotspot feature enabled con non replaceable battery :(
customer_reviews.author: captlid

customer_reviews.title: USB data cable missing and hard to find
customer_reviews.text: Just got this yesterday, seemed absolutely wonderful till I realized that no usb data from phone to computer was included. None of the many here seemed to work except one found after exhausting every other possibility Usually no big deal, but type in at Amazon Moto g (3rd generation) usb data cable. There is a parsity of selection and a number of iffy reviews. If you have read this far then you get a Bonus: a Kindle micro usb from it'scharger WORKS! You are welcome.
customer_reviews.author: Caligula68

customer_reviews.title: I don't recommend this phone.
customer_reviews.text: Ever since I got this phone I've had issues with it. I never had a motorola before but I got it because a friend kept saying her moto was indestructible... Now, I''m going to have to sell it to her to get a new phone because the phone doesn't like me and I don't like it. Cons: Not enough space It burnt an external memory card Charge lasts one day internet connection is slow Apps keep crashing Erased all my contact names Pros: Durable Motion sensor (this can also be a con) Decent camera
customer_reviews.author: Ruben J.

customer_reviews.title: The only good feature is the camera and the camera app
customer_reviews.text: Very slow. Memory is really low so phone keeps asking me to delete photos. I should have returned this earlier. I am not sure if there are some hardware issues as well. It is very frustrating to use. The only good feature is the camera and the camera app. But other than that, I find this phone to be so much worse than current technology. Wasn't expecting this from Motorola.
customer_reviews.author: Sasidhar K.

customer_reviews.title: Good phone for the price
customer_reviews.text: So far so good with this one. I bought it for my daughter to use while she is in college in Europe and it has worked quite well. Seems to be a good phone for the price. The only glitch I have found with this is that there seems to be one spot in the upper left hand corner of the touch screen that is not responsive. A very small area right in the corner, and hasn't been anything she has felt caused an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: so great! This is our first smartphone
customer_reviews.text: So far, so great! This is our first smartphone, and we love it. So much versatility. It came (last month) with the with the Lollipop OS still on the smartphone. Easy, prompted download to Marshmellow 6.0. Took maybe 10 minutes. The SD external storage is a must; especially for large music capability. We got the 16G. And we bought this unlocked GSM model to use abroad.
customer_reviews.author: LLC

customer_reviews.title: problems with sound
customer_reviews.text: I am truly a huge Motorola fan !! But unfortunately this phone disappointed me. First time I ever has quality issues with a Motorola product . Notifications are only heard once or twice . Than u have to turn off phone tap the back than it will work again. Frustrating ..also no notification light ! I gave phone away to a family member needing financial help. And went to different Motorola phone . So far so good .
customer_reviews.author: vb

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone!
customer_reviews.text: Just a great all around phone! Quick and has a nice size screen. Very pleased with the purchase. I had been looking at upgrading my iPhone 4s for quite a few months and kept coming back to this phone. So many features, waterproof, great camera, largr batteru at a low price, I just had to give it a shot. This phone did not disappoint at all. Been using it for two weeks now and am very pleased and with the larger battery, I have power all day. Great phone!
customer_reviews.author: Rolling Home RV Rentals

customer_reviews.title: This phone is perfect for what I need it to do with breaking ...
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a bigger screen but didn't want to pay a fortune. This phone is perfect for what I need it to do with breaking the bank. It downloaded all my apps using my own sim card from my other phone with any issues. I did lose my pictures, due to my own fault of not backing up the old phone first. So back up everything before transferring to new phone.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Sanguinetti

customer_reviews.title: solid product at a fair price from a less popular brand.
customer_reviews.text: Formerly known as "the only phone maker in the US of A." It's a shame that Motorola never got more love & had to be taken over by Lenovo, because I was happy to buy an American product, that I thought was really good quality, plus I liked the idea of customization through MotoMaker. Anyway, this phone has been flawless since purchase, & I still would consider buying a Moto device in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great phone!  No extra garbage apps hogging memory!
customer_reviews.text: Came from Motorola unlocked without the usual garbage apps that the wireless service providers load up new phones with! Just had to swap aim cards from my wife's old phone to this one. Did have speaker issues initially but once my wife upgraded to the latest android OS that has not been an issue. Was not able to determine what the source of the problem was. My wife has been very happy. One thing we learned from the last phone we purchased is that you must have a minimum 16gb of internal memory if you want to download many apps.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Moran

customer_reviews.title: Be carefull with the battery!
customer_reviews.text: Be careful with the battery! I didnt charge it right away and it drained to 0%. When I tried to charge it nothing happened. The battery seemed dead, there was only a blue led when I plugged the charger. So I had to send it to a technician who replaced the battery, and now it's working. I couldnt return it because I dont live in the US. Now its working well. But the 8GB are half used by Android OS, and the remaining 4GB are not much.
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo Cabrera

customer_reviews.title: Died after < 90 days.
customer_reviews.text: This would have five stars, except for the fact that on May 24th, 2016 .. just 82 days after I received it from Amazon .. the phone has died. Not only did it die, it wiped out the filesystem on its internal memory AND on my SD card! I lost everything. Keep backups, folks. I lost photos of my granddaughter, whom I am no longer allowed to see ..
customer_reviews.author: Debborah Richmond

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Not the most modern Motorola, but in all more friendly to use than newer models. Water resistant, made some pictures under the water. I had before the 8G model, now the 16G, clear difference in processing speed.
customer_reviews.author: Oilfield Hand

customer_reviews.title: This phone is great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I came from an Apple 4s. This phone is great for the price. The two most important things for me is voice quality on the hand set and blue tooth in car and both sound very good. Battery life, I get full day with ease and have yet to actually run to 0% since owning for 2 plus weeks. Everything else works well most of the time, just not as slick or consistent as an apple device. For less than 1/3 the cost this phone works for me.
customer_reviews.author: john mayek

customer_reviews.title: I love the phone and the price tag
customer_reviews.text: I've had my phone for a few months now. It is slow and freezes frequently. I get numerous "app is not responding" messages daily. I have factory reset the phone and it did nothing to fix the issues. I am not sure where the problem actually lie. I love the phone and the price tag. I cannot give it a better review because it is very frustrating to have apps crash several times a day.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlyn Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Word of caution - Make sure you get the XT1548 if you want your SIM card to work
customer_reviews.text: This phone was everything I hoped for, expect the part about being compatible with the Verizon network. I got the phones up and running without any problems, but when it came time to install the SIM cards we found a big problem. It took the better part of the day to identify the problem. We were shipper Moto G3 model number XT1540 which has an antenna the was incompatible with the cell phone network. I've returned the phone and now need to see about getting the correct model number.
customer_reviews.author: Redhead Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: This phone has worked very well for multiple years now. Will buy another Moto when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: dk

customer_reviews.title: Really good deal
customer_reviews.text: It's a great deal for an unlocked phone. The battery - particularly standby time - is incredible. I usually get around 5 hours SOT. Even though the CPU isn't the fastest, I haven't had any problems with app management or multitasking (disclaimer: I don't play games on my phone). Besides the OnePlus X, there is no other phone that has the same specs at this price range. My only problem with this phone is with software updates. Motorola have been dragging their feet with the Marshmallow update. I can assume that is how it will be with future Android updates.
customer_reviews.author: Jav

customer_reviews.title: It is best affordable phone
customer_reviews.text: It is best affordable phone.... The only problem is i got a defective unit. A vertical "line on screen" appear after i tried it for 1 day use. Now i'm waiting for a replacement from Amazon. I bought it with 1 day shipping and the replacement will come in the next 5 days...improve it, Amazon
customer_reviews.author: XPR98

customer_reviews.title: No need to spend more money...this phone is all you need
customer_reviews.text: Awesome phone for the money. This is the 4th Moto G I have bought and it has all the qualities of a much more expensive phone. There is really no reason to pay $500 to $700 for a phone...this does it all. In fact, I gave my girlfriend my 1 year old MotoX and after a week, she gave it back. Much better photos and battery life with the G.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M

customer_reviews.title: I have this phone for a good while, maybe 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I have this phone for a good while, maybe 6 months. I really like it and like that it came with the latest version of OS. Frankly unless you need the latest and greatest this phone is excellent . I don't use a cover of anything, the screen is good, signal good, speed good, really there is lots to like and not much to worry about.
customer_reviews.author: MR Cart

customer_reviews.title: Nice!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very good, fluid and fast phone in spite that its a budget phone, but its the best budget phone available...i am very happy with it, i used to go for very expensive flagship phone but this is pointless for me now, this one handles all my daily tasks very well...
customer_reviews.author: Eric Allan

customer_reviews.title: The phone was great at first
customer_reviews.text: The phone was great at first, but after half of year of using it, everything started going downhill. Phone is extremely laggy and gets super hot without me even doing anything on the phone.This is an updated review and I hope Motorola get their s*** together. DO NOT BUY this phone if you consider long term investment... UPDATE This phone is acting up again as it doesn't even recognize the sd card. WOW. I would never in my life buy a Motorola phone ever again...
customer_reviews.author: Yangfizz

customer_reviews.title: Great cellphone!As new!
customer_reviews.text: Received the refurbished cell phone quickly, and it was even better than described by seller...It is entirely as new, no signs of any wear, and original packaging....with charger and cable..And it works flawlessly also!...So great phone from an excellent seller at a very good price!
customer_reviews.author: Philo

customer_reviews.title: mom approves
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my fifty something year old mother. She is a fan of buying awful phones that won't let her do what she wants. She runs out of space so quickly when downloading games. This is a great, affordable phone to buy and slap Android 6.0 onto. Merged her sd card and internal memory so no worries about it filling up. She complains about everything but hasn't complained about this phone for the month that she's had it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Fahrenheit

customer_reviews.title: I thought that paying less than $200 for a Motorola phone would be a great bargain but I've decided to switch to an iPhone ...
customer_reviews.text: The phone worked OK at the beginning but eventually it would not ring and sent callers directly to voicemail. Screen navigation also became difficult as it required odd use of the navigation buttons to switch from the phone to apps and back again.This all may have developed because of it updating to Android 6 but that may just be a coincidence. I thought that paying less than $200 for a Motorola phone would be a great bargain but I've decided to switch to an iPhone to gain back some reliability and predictability. I guess we all get what we pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Dwyer

customer_reviews.title: Good Value Smartphone
customer_reviews.text: My first Android smartphone, and I like the features, size and overall good quality of this phone. Battery life is excellent for my use - I get several days use without recharging (very little internet or other data usage). Nice clear display, very responsive to touch. Fulfills my needs at an excellent price - good value.
customer_reviews.author: Chaltar

customer_reviews.title: Great phone
customer_reviews.text: Great phone for the price. Arrived on time, nice design and easy to hold. I like the shape and design of these Moto phones. The camera is very fast and nice to use. I just like everything about this phone for this price!
customer_reviews.author: KevMc

customer_reviews.title: I love it. Didn't have any trouble using Tracfone with ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Didn't have any trouble using Tracfone with it. Got triple minutes with it. It has a great camera also. I would recommend it if you want to buy a phone for the Bring your own phone at Tracfone.
customer_reviews.author: Pamla Langford

customer_reviews.title: Overall okay
customer_reviews.text: 1. Not very happy as this occasionally gives me trouble with the bluetooth. It shows as connected to my car bluetooth but no sound will come from the car bluetooth. Same happens with my plantronics headset. Both of these bluetooth headsets had never before given me trouble with say nexus 6 or my earlier samsung s3. This gets fixed only on restarting the moto g! 2. Does not have restart option.
customer_reviews.author: Chandresh Prakash

customer_reviews.title: I could not be happier! Best online purchase ever
customer_reviews.text: I could not be happier! Best online purchase ever! Seller was very nice and available for all of my questions after I got the phone about the SIM card qset up with Straight Talk and other dumb questions I had. Would certainly come back. Best phone out there for the price, too. Just watch the Youtube comparisons.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Flanagan

customer_reviews.title: for the price but there are probably better phones for less money
customer_reviews.text: It was O.K. for the price but there are probably better phones for less money. Motorola could have done much better. The phone is slow, affords very few genuine amenities and adding extra memory does nothing to fix the slowness. Shop around, or wait until the 4th generation. Maybe 5th.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this phone, it's been holding up great since the day I bought it. IPX7 rating is great, it's technically only good for 1 foot, but I brought this baby into the Atlantic ocean around 3 or 4 feet deep and it didn't skip a beat. This is the best phone I've owned so far and it was cheap too!
customer_reviews.author: John August

customer_reviews.title: The camera is much better as well as all the other phone features
customer_reviews.text: Replace first gen phone four months ago. The camera is much better as well as all the other phone features. Took a little while to get used to the larger size but now I don't know how the smaller gen 1 was acceptable. Overall, a reasonably priced phone, with great features, and high quality build.
customer_reviews.author: D. S.

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Like everything else I've ever owned Motorola this is complete junk. I can't even tell you how many times I've had to do a factory reset just to get it to function. This is notoriously Motorola's solution to everything. POS.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Betenson

customer_reviews.title: I am very sad about this
customer_reviews.text: When I take a picture and save on phone memory it is ok, but if I save on sd memory, became black and said is not a picture and i lose a lot of important work photo. And I try with three different sd memory, I format them and nothing!!! I try to open in the computer and the same thing happen I copy all contacts from my other phone, and I can see them on contact list but when someone call me or sent me a message, not appear the name of the contact. I am very sad about this phone
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... my old iPhone but otherwise this is a very good phone especially considering the price
customer_reviews.text: I prefer the voice mail feature on my old iPhone but otherwise this is a very good phone especially considering the price. I may buy another one to use as a backup for this one. It is fast, the screen looks good, and I like being able to put internet shortcuts directly on the screen.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: and one fine day the phone stopped recognizing the SIM card with ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a device that died on me within six months. The software updates messed up google functions, and one fine day the phone stopped recognizing the SIM card with a " No service" message. Lo and behold! my old IPhone 4 was able to detect the card and connect to my provide. No wonder Apple Devices are outperforming third grade Androids. I contacted Amazon customer service who asked me to take this up with Motorola. Thanks Amazon for selling a dud......buyers beware.
customer_reviews.author: Ravi Ramesh Pathak

customer_reviews.title: Excellent experience, low price.
customer_reviews.text: Exceptional phone given the price and hardware specs. Runs very smoothly for a phone with 1gb ram. Only issue is 8gb storage runs out very, very quickly -- especially if you have a good amount of apps. This thing has great battery life, and the few Motorola apps on the phone are very unobtrusive. You're basically getting a stock android experience with a few tiny extras that are actually useful and not bloatware. Overall, an impressive package for the price. Very worth it. Note to all prospective buyers: Expect to slim down on the amount of apps you have / photos stored on phone.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Tan

customer_reviews.title: 64GB Micro SD card works
customer_reviews.text: Its a great phone. All the other reviews explain it all in great details. I just want to let all know that the phone can take a 64gb micro sd card without a problem. This is what i got for the phone and it shows all the storage and i tested the card with pictures and videos.
customer_reviews.author: Kati R.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I had before a Moto G 2nd Gen
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I had before a Moto G 2nd Gen, so now I buy Moto G 3rd Gen, its been 5 years using motorolas phones and I never had a complain about them, I love about the moto 5 that the get the androids updates on time! The performance its excelent, and the cam wow its amazing so much better than the previus Moto g. I'm from Venezuela and the network its good too,
customer_reviews.author: Dhanna

customer_reviews.title: Its a great phone for the price
customer_reviews.text: Its a great phone for the price. It's not state of the art, but handles daily phone usage very well. I wont call myself a tech savvy person, but I do use 8-10 apps each day quite frequently. I dont see any lags / freeze ups while switching apps and battery life is quite good too. It lasts all day without needing a charge.
customer_reviews.author: Raviraj K.

customer_reviews.title: Not Unlocked
customer_reviews.text: Phone comes from Jasper Wireless and it is NOT UNLOCKED!!! You cannot reach Jasper Wireless anymore because they have been bought out by Cisco and a customer support number does not exist. ATT, etc. cannot help. This phone is a brick.
customer_reviews.author: Klaus

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: A good phone. Has all basic features anyone needs Does not make sense to pay more than this for a phone
customer_reviews.author: Student

customer_reviews.title: Really great phone
customer_reviews.text: Love it so far! Writing my review from it now. Had the phone about 2 weeks and no complaints so far! Perfect size and weight, great camera, nice functions, and fast. I do keep the screen and full brightness. The battery is a lot better than my htc one. Fantastic price for this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Stine

customer_reviews.title: Better than my old phone
customer_reviews.text: I just received this phone and I love it. I have small hands and this fit in my hands perfectly. I had a phone that was much bigger and didn't really like the fit. The pictures are good and the extra features are cool. I understand that some people would rather have a bigger memory and this only has 8GB but I don't mind it at all I can always slip in a micro SD card. Its overall a great phone.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Had to return.
customer_reviews.text: It seemed to be a very nice phone. I had to return it because It would not recognize the SIM card.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Miller

customer_reviews.title: Wow, an amazing phone!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! Moto G (3rd Generation) is about the 10th smartphone that I have owned and it's amazing compared to my previous phones! It is an absolute bargain compared to the price of $179 I paid. It looks expensive and has an excellent sturdy, sleek feel. The camera is much better than the 2nd generation Moto G which I just replaced with this phone. Highly recommend it unless you have the money to throw for a $650 phone....you know which one I am talking about :)
customer_reviews.author: SB, Santa Fe, NM

customer_reviews.title: I love this phone!
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my third month with this phone. I have NO ISSUES with it whatsoever. I absolutely love it! The sound is good. The clarity rocks. The battery still is running well. This is a fantastic phone. The price makes is even better.
customer_reviews.author: California Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Really waterproof?
customer_reviews.text: I mean, its ok for a cheap phone but come on! I jumped into my pool with the phone on my hand (cover secured) and i didn't submerge more than 1 meter. Then, i came out the water, took the cover off, i dried it and the water damage check was still white. After some hours the display turned purple and the resolution changed to 360. BAD
customer_reviews.author: santiago nardelli

customer_reviews.title: Excellent phone!
customer_reviews.text: For the price tag the phone is excellent. The software is bare bones Android, with minimal and very useful additions by Motorola. Phone is very responsive for the avg. specs, no issues here. Screen is not as bright as an amoled on a sunny day, but not really a problem. Works perfectly well with At&t and its MVNOs.
customer_reviews.author: review_generator

product_meta.title: Motorola Moto G (3rd Generation) - White- 8 GB - Global GSM Unlocked Phone
product_meta.description: Color:White| Size:8 GBQuad core processing power in a great value product. 4.5" display. 5MP rear camera with a VGA front facing camera. Great 24hr battery performance with a 2390mAh battery. Personalize with colored bands.
feature_bullets: 13 MP camera which includes a color-balancing dual LED Flash
5" HD display; Brilliant display quality and the strength of Corning Gorilla Glass
Quad core processing power in a great value product
5MP rear camera with a VGA front facing camera
Great 24hr battery performance with a 2470mAh battery
Expandable memory; Slot for an optional mircoSD card with up to 32 GB capacity.
4G LTE Speed; Browse, stream music, watch video, and play games at blazing speed.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars1,991 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
specifications.Additional Features: Touchscreen, Built-in-gps, Bluetooth-enabled, Dual-camera, Lte, Smartphone
